New Records: Maheesh Theekshana set a new World Cup record by facing 91 balls, the most by a No. 9 batter in the history of the tournament.
Maheesh Theekshana's 91 is also the second most number of balls faced by a No. 9 batter in ODI cricket.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka crumbled as they lost 5 wickets in the first powerplay.
Trent Boult picked up 3 wickets with the new ball, finding some form while Lockie Ferguson, Mitchell Santner and Rachin Ravindra picked up 2 wickets each.
Sri Lanka slipped to 70 for 5 and then to 128 for 9 before Theekshana and Madushanka added 43 runs for the 10th wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite Theekshana's effort, Sri Lanka were not able to last the full quota of 50 overs in what has been a disappointing World Cup campaign for the former champions, who are in danger of missing out on Champions Trophy 2025.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Maheesh Theekshana hit 39 not out in a rearguard effort to help Sri Lanka post a respectable total in their final league game of the World Cup against New Zealand at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Thursday, November 9.
Maheesh Theekshana added 43 runs in 87 balls for the last wicket along with Dilshan Madushanka as Sri Lanka huffed and puffed to post 171 in 46.4 overs.
Others: Kusal Perera scored a 28-ball 51 from opener Kusal Perera.
Jay Prakash Yadav holds the record after having faced 92 balls in an ODI against New Zealand in 2005.
